profile.name: Hank Schrader
profile.headline: Assistant Special Agent in Charge leading multi-agency investigations that dismantled Southwest drug networks. 18-year federal law enforcement career with expertise in complex criminal investigations, forensic analysis, and cross-border operations.
profile.executiveSummary: Decorated federal agent who rose from field agent to ASAC through relentless investigation work and leadership under fire. Led the investigation that ultimately identified and dismantled one of the largest methamphetamine operations in the Southwest. Known for combining instinctive investigative judgment with methodical evidence collection, and for maintaining pursuit of cases that others abandoned.

evidence.description: Connected disparate evidence threads across multiple years, ultimately identifying the manufacturer operating under deep cover
